Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the level of support Trump received from women during the 2016 presidential election, stating that he got "52 percent" support, when in fact he received 41 percent support among all women.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Trump received 41 percent support among all women, not 52 percent as stated.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support or evidence to back up the assertion of receiving 52 percent support from women.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the audience is aware of the correct percentage of support Trump received from women, which is misleading.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim ignores the alternative explanation that Trump received different levels of support from different demographic groups of women, such as 25 percent among Latino women and 4 percent among black women.
